name: Vietnamese Cuisine Online Quiz | Vietnamese Foods | 10 Questions

questions.text: This is perhaps the most important condiment on a Vietnamese table. It is a type of fish sauce. What do the Vietnamese call it?
questions.explanation:
nuoc mam.

	Although it stinks to high heaven, you will not regret adding it to your soup or stir-fried meal.

questions.text: Which of the following terms refers to Vietnamese rice noodles?
questions.explanation:
Pho.

Pho noodle soup is probably the most popular Vietnamese dish available.

questions.text: What somewhat controversial white, crystalline powder is used extensively in many Vietnamese dishes?
questions.explanation:
MSG & monosodium glutamate.

	MSG, or monosodium glutamate, is controversial because some studies show it can have a harmful effect on people.

questions.text: Called 'xa' in Vietnamese, this fragrant grass is used in curries, soups and other dishes for flavoring. What is it commonly called in the West?
questions.explanation:
lemon grass & citronella & Lemon & lemongrass.

	If you use lemon grass, you should only use the base of the plant for flavoring. Fresh is best!

questions.text: What fruit's nectar is very commonly used in Vietnamese desserts?
questions.explanation:
coconut.

	A coconut milk dessert is wonderful for soothing the palate after a spicy Vietnamese meal.

questions.text: What sort of bread is widely used in Vietnam, especially for making sandwiches?
questions.explanation:
french bread.

	This is of course a remnant of the French colonialization of Vietnam. Other French culinary items are also still present in Vietnamese cuisine, such as cheese, pate and coffee.

questions.text: What is another name for the herb, cilantro, which is frequently used as a garnish and in soups and other dishes in Vietnamese cooking?
questions.explanation:
coriander & Chinese parsley.

	Fresh cilantro is an absolute necessity for fine Vietnamese cuisine.  You must at least have it if you plan to eat pho!

questions.text: What 'paper' is used to wrap vermicelli noodles, fresh vegetables, shrimp and pork?
questions.explanation:
rice paper.

	The finished product, known as spring rolls in the West, is usually dipped into peanut and or hoisin sauce.

questions.text: What sweet-tasting, thick reddish-brown sauce is frequently used in Vietnam as a condiment?
questions.explanation:
hoisin sauce.

	It's used as a dipping sauce for appetizers and main dishes, such as spring rolls or pho. (Can you tell I like that stuff?)

questions.text: During and after your meal, you will want to wash the food down with beer. Which beer is the best-selling Vietnamese made brew?
questions.explanation:
33.

	I don't know why, but it seems that the Vietnamese are fond of naming things with numbers.  I guess that's why so many places are called 'Pho 79' and 'Pho 55'!  Now, get yourself to the nearest Vietnamese restaurant and chow down...that's an order!
